body:
I checked and see  my generated query is bit different with your generated query 
```php
$list = $this->Categories->find('list'); //query 1
$list2 = $this->Posts->Categories->find('list'); //query 2
```

cake3 for both query 
```
SELECT 
  Categories.id AS `Categories__id`, 
  Categories.title AS `Categories__title` 
FROM 
  categories Categories
```

cake 4.x branch (latest commit until now  https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/commit/6fec49c146 )

cake4  for first query same is cake 3 
for second query ( `$list2 = $this->Posts->Categories->find('list');` )
```
SELECT 
  Categories.id AS `Categories__id`, 
  Categories.title AS `Categories__title` 
FROM 
  categories Categories 
  INNER JOIN categories_posts CategoriesPosts ON Categories.id = (CategoriesPosts.category_id)
```


my query is
```
FROM 
  categories Categories 
  INNER JOIN categories_posts ....
```
but for you 
```
FROM 
  books Books 
  INNER JOIN books_categories ...
```

anyway if you have correct rows in pivot tables 
your query will works well and will result rows

ok, but if we stick with my example above we are in the add function of the BooksController.

In there I cant just access the current Model with 
`$this->Books->find('list')`

i have to go through my current Model into the other connected models to get data from other models, therefore
`$this->Books->Categories->find('list');`

But this line doesn't work now anymore, because it makes the mentioned inner join.

In my "old" CakePHP3 program this line `$this->Books->Categories->find('list');` gets me all available Categories without any join.

Therefore do I have to load the other Model into my Controller to get all available Categories to get them into the view?

Something like that?

```
use Cake\ORM\TableRegistry;
$query = TableRegistry::getTableLocator()->get('Categories')->find();
```

My problem here is, that I want to "prefill" all available categories in the categories table and then make all these categories available in a dropdown in the add template of the books table.

I can kinda understand, that the "new" way only gets you already connected categories in the BooksController, but how do I add Books to already present Categories that don't already have connections and therefore entries in the pivot table?

And yes, im sorry, i posted the wrong DebugKit SQL Query

As @saeideng mentioned, it should have been

```
SELECT 
  Categories.id AS `Categories__id`, 
  Categories.name AS `Categories__name` 
FROM 
  categories Categories 
  INNER JOIN books_categories BooksCategories ON Categories.id = (BooksCategories.category_id) 
LIMIT 
  200
```
I was able to reproduce the additional join locally. It seems like this may be related to 6b8d5de2013  checking the finder conditions incorrectly. I'll get this fixed.

>Therefore do I have to load the other Model into my Controller to get all available Categories to get them into the view?

no , I first was thinking this is intended in cake 4 but I did another test , and I checked `4.0 migration-guide` and I see this in not intended  and this is a bug in cake 4 (beta),

 I put now a new method into `Posts` table 
```php
    public function aMethod(){
        ....
        return $this->Categories->find('list');
    }
```
this  use in many use cases , but for now it executes with extra join
and this changes user's program behavior and should be fix
so as @markstory mentioned and labeled this issue , this is a bug and will fix
unless we do this as new behavior and with documented this as behavior changed in cake 4
 
thank you for reporting

issue.title: Fix BelongsToMany::find() applying joins

milestone.description:
4.0.0 is an *API breaking* release. It will:

* Remove the features deprecated in 3.x.

Code that works in the latest 3.x with no deprecation warnings should work in 4.0.0 as well.

See the roadmap for more information https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/wiki/4.0-Roadmap

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
The association find proxy method should only apply joins if the association has junction conditions. If a custom finder is used then that finder method should apply the required joins.

Fixes #13712

body:
After manually applying your changes from the pull request I indeed can confirm, that this change fixes my problem.

Thank you for the quick fix @markstory!

I'm looking forward to seeing the pull request being applied and I can apply this change with the next composer update.
